cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north Wednesday night and then north-northeast Thursday, skirting the southeast U.S. coastline and then passing offshore of the Mid-Atlantic toward New England and Atlantic Canada.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Outer Banks, North Carolina (possible coastal brush/landfall)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches presently extend from north of Deerfield Beach, FL to South Santee River, SC.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings from Jupiter Inlet, FL to Ponte Vedra Beach, FL and Lantana, FL to Savannah River, GA.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through the Carolinas; impacts then spread northward along the Mid-Atlantic coast including Delaware, New Jersey and southern New England.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Friday night into early Saturday as the center passes well offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (1–2 ft) possible along Delaware Bay and lower Delaware River with on-shore flow Friday night, but values above 3 ft are not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain could produce 1–3 inches with isolated 4-inch pockets Friday–Saturday, mainly along the Delaware beaches and lower Delaware River valley.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning mid-week and persisting through Saturday; minor navigation restrictions due to long-period swells.
